intro: Adonis leiosepala, commonly known as the slender adonis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive silver-gray underside. Adonis leiosepala thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats.
